item.title: Wamco 调整债券策略，努力留住投资人员
item.description: 西方资产管理公司（Western Asset Management Co.【原文：Western Asset Management Co. is revamping some of its fixed-income strategies and trying to retain investment staff, as the once-hailed bond giant continues to face the fallout from its star trader being charged with criminal fraud.】

item.title: 据说香港长江基建正在考虑出售价值 40 亿英镑的英国 Eversholt Rail 公司
item.description: 知情人士透露，长江基建控股有限公司（CK Infrastructure Holdings Ltd.）正在评估 Eversholt Rail 的各种选择，包括可能出售这家英国机车车辆公司，其估值可能高达 40 亿英镑（49 亿美元）。【原文：CK Infrastructure Holdings Ltd. is evaluating options for Eversholt Rail, including a possible sale that may value the British rolling stock company at as much as £4 billion ($4.9 billion), people with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 法国将在 2025 年预算中向高收入者征税 20 亿欧元
item.description: 法国财政部官员表示，法国政府预计，为打击最富有个人的税收优化行为而计划征收的税款将在今年筹集到 20 亿欧元（约合 21 亿美元）。【原文：The French government expects a planned levy to counter tax optimization by the richest individuals to raise €2 billion ($2.1 billion) this year, according to Finance Ministry officials.】

item.title: 特朗普在达沃斯敦促降低油价和利率
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周四在达沃斯向世界各国领导人发表讲话时表示，他将要求沙特阿拉伯和其他欧佩克国家 "降低石油成本"，并重申他威胁要利用关税将制造业带回美国。【原文：President Donald Trump said he would ask Saudi Arabia and other OPEC nations to “bring down the cost of oil” and reiterated his threat to use tariffs to bring manufacturing back to the US as he addressed world leaders gathered in Davos on Thursday.】

item.title: 据称 Triton 正探讨以 20 亿欧元出售德国 Kelvion 公司
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，收购公司 Triton Partners 正在探讨出售德国冷却设备供应商 Kelvion 的事宜，交易价格可能超过 20 亿欧元（21 亿美元）。【原文：Buyout firm Triton Partners is exploring a sale of Kelvion, a German supplier of cooling equipment, that could fetch more than €2 billion ($2.1 billion), according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 财政部长称欧洲经济下滑令瑞士担忧
item.description: 瑞士财政部长担心欧盟和德国的经济衰退也会打击瑞士企业，因为这两个国家都是瑞士最重要的贸易伙伴。【原文：Switzerland’s finance minister is concerned that the economic slump in the European Union and Germany will also hit Swiss companies, as both are among the most important trading partners of the country.】

item.title: 中国天齐锂业发布盈利警告并停止扩张
item.description: 天齐锂业公司（Tianqi Lithium Corp. ）警告称，由于电池金属市场持续低迷，该公司预计 2024 年的净亏损将高达 82 亿元人民币（11 亿美元），并将停止在澳大利亚的扩建项目。【原文：Tianqi Lithium Corp. warned that it expects to post a net loss of as much as 8.2 billion yuan ($1.1 billion) for 2024, and is halting an expansion project in Australia as a downturn in the battery metals markets drags on.】

item.title: PE 公司 EQT 将在 2025 年进行更多首次公开募股，称市场 "光明而开放
item.description: 瑞典私募股权公司 EQT AB 希望利用股市好转的机会，继 2024 年的强劲表现之后，通过首次公开募股实现更多的货币化退出。【原文：Swedish private equity firm EQT AB is looking to take advantage of an improving stock market to monetize more exits via initial public offerings, following a strong run in 2024.】

item.title: Pimco 等大牌公司积极管理的债券基金引领复兴
item.description: 太平洋投资管理公司（Pacific Investment Management Co.）等业内重量级公司积极管理的美国债券基金去年吸引了最多的新投资，因为资金在经历了两年的枯竭期后又开始回流。【原文：US bond funds actively managed by industry heavyweights like Pacific Investment Management Co. attracted the most new investment last year as money returned after a two-year dry spell.】

item.title: 私人信贷在 IPO 市场低迷之际扶持成长中的科技公司
item.description: 私人信用贷款机构正蜂拥而至，为准备上市的大型、快速增长的科技公司提供融资，利用首次公开募股市场的低迷，帮助它们在此期间获得流动资金。【原文：Private credit lenders are flocking to finance large, fast-growing technology companies gearing up to go public, taking advantage of a lackluster market for initial public offerings and helping them get access to liquidity in the meantime.】

item.title: 尽管锂供应过剩问题日益严重，智利仍对锂扩张保持信心
item.description: 智利拥有世界上最大的锂储量，即使在全球锂储量过剩加剧、电池金属行业受到挤压的情况下，智利仍有信心让投资者竞相获得开采新矿藏的许可。【原文：Chile, home to the world’s biggest lithium reserves, is confident that investors will compete for licenses to drill new deposits even amid a worsening global glut that’s squeezing the battery-metal industry.】

item.title: 特朗普威胁征收石油关税，墨西哥耗资 200 亿美元的炼油厂宣告失败
item.description:
谢因鲍姆总统面临压力，要求减少墨西哥对美国燃料的依赖

。【原文：

President Sheinbaum is under pressure to reduce Mexican reliance on US fuel

】

item.title: 前谷歌和 Meta 高管打造情感感知型人工智能销售代理
item.description: 来自 Alphabet 公司旗下谷歌公司、Meta Platforms 公司和三星电子公司的三位前工程领导人为一家新创公司筹集了 1000 万美元，该公司致力于让人工智能驱动的客户销售代理更加贴近情感。【原文：Three former engineering leaders from Alphabet Inc.’s Google, Meta Platforms Inc. and Samsung Electronics Co. have raised $10 million for a new startup focused on making artificial intelligence-powered customer sales agents more emotionally attuned.】

item.title: 保加利亚因通胀标准未获通过而暂缓加入欧元计划
item.description: 保加利亚新组建的政府将暂缓采用欧元的下一步行动，直到这个巴尔干国家正式达到欧盟的要求。【原文：Bulgaria’s newly formed government will hold off taking the next step toward adopting the euro until the Balkan nation formally meets European Union requirements.】

item.title: 欧洲银行乐观前景为首次公开募股和股权出售铺平道路
item.description: 银行股前景看好，是收购公司和欧洲各国政府抛售股权的大好时机。【原文：A positive outlook for banking stocks is making it an opportune time for buyout firms and European governments to offload their stakes.】

item.title: 欧盟计划提议将天然气储存目标延长至 2027 年
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，欧盟委员会计划寻求将该地区具有约束力的天然气库存目标延长至 2027 年，以帮助缓解持续的供应担忧。【原文：The European Commission plans to seek an extension of the region’s binding gas-inventory targets until 2027 to help ease continuing supply concerns, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 太空探索技术公司（SpaceX）的加入促使大量新现金涌入鲜为人知的 ETF
item.description: 在投资了埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的太空探索技术公司 SpaceX 之后，一家名不见经传的商店推出的交易所交易基金吸引了在线交易商的注意，并聚集了资金流。【原文：An exchange-traded fund from a relatively unknown shop is catching the attention of online traders and gathering flows after investing in Elon Musk’s SpaceX.】

item.title: 安大略教师公司首席执行官看到了抢购欧洲廉价资产的机会
item.description: 安大略教师养老金计划首席执行官表示，由于其他投资者仍专注于美国市场，安大略教师养老金计划正将更多注意力转向欧洲市场。【原文：Ontario Teachers’ Pension Plan is turning more attention to European markets as other investors remain fixated on the US, its chief executive officer said.】

item.title: 库尔德斯坦对伊拉克议会推迟石油成本投票感到 "惊讶
item.description: 库尔德斯坦地区政府总理表示，他对已批准的石油生产成本计划发生变化以及伊拉克议会本周未对该计划进行表决感到 "惊讶"，这可能会对重启已停止近两年的出口造成新的障碍。【原文：The Kurdistan Regional Government’s prime minister said he was “surprised” by changes to an approved plan for oil production costs and the Iraqi parliament not voting on it this week, potentially creating a fresh hurdle in restarting exports that have been halted for almost two years.】

item.title: 华尔街由科技推动的债券交易额达到创纪录的 1 万亿美元
item.description: 一种以技术为驱动力的债券交易方法，可帮助公司一次性转移数百种证券，今年刚刚创下了最好的业绩。【原文：A tech-powered approach to bond trading that helps firms move hundreds of securities in one go has just posted its best year yet.】

item.title: 特朗普打击可再生能源，Calpers 寻求私有化交易
item.description: 加利福尼亚州公务员退休系统是全球最大、对气候最友好的投资者之一，该系统正在想方设法应对唐纳德-特朗普总统的首要任务之一：促进美国化石燃料行业的发展，取消绿色补贴。【原文：The California Public Employees’ Retirement System, one of the world’s largest and most climate-friendly investors, is seeking ways to navigate one of President Donald Trump’s top priorities: boosting the US fossil fuel industry and killing green subsidies.】

item.title: 沙特阿拉伯称在美国投资了 7700 亿美元，MBS 希望获得更多投资
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯在美国的投资超过 7700 亿美元，并表示随着沙特对经济进行全面改革，预计与华盛顿的关系 "将继续蓬勃发展"。【原文：Saudi Arabia has investments of more than $770 billion in the US and said it expects relations with Washington “will continue to be flourishing” as the kingdom pursues its broad economic overhaul.】

item.title: 加拿大 12 月零售销售额可能因税收减免而大幅增长
item.description: 加拿大消费者似乎已经接受了利率的下降，并以近两年来最强劲的消费势头结束了假日季。【原文：Canadian consumers appear to have embraced falling interest rates and ended the holiday season with the strongest spending in nearly two years.】

item.title: 利益相关者比尔-福特称 TikTok 正在考虑出售的替代方案
item.description: 据董事会成员比尔-福特（Bill Ford）称，ByteDance 正在探索一项交易，以便在不出售美国业务的情况下保持 TikTok 在美国的运营。【原文：ByteDance is exploring a deal to keep TikTok running in the US without selling its operations there, according to board member Bill Ford.】

item.title: 丹麦希望在特朗普发飙之际增加格陵兰岛防务开支
item.description: 丹麦国防部长希望在 2033 年之前将北欧国家的军费开支总额提高到 5000 亿克朗（约合 700 亿美元）以上，以加大对北极地区安全的投资。【原文：Denmark’s defense minister wants to raise the Nordic country’s total military spending to more than 500 billion kroner ($70 billion) through 2033 as it seeks to ramp up investment in security in the Arctic region.】

item.title: 俄罗斯石油船寻找新国旗躲避制裁
item.description: 由于美国和英国的制裁给莫斯科的航运网络造成了巨大压力，俄罗斯油轮船队的一大部分被迫更换船旗。【原文：A chunk of Russia’s oil tanker fleet is being forced to change the flag they sail under as US and UK sanctions heap pressure on Moscow’s shipping network.】

item.title: 卡地亚呼吁帮助历峰集团市值达到 1000 亿瑞士法郎
item.description: 瑞士奢侈品集团历峰集团（Richemont）的股票市值首次突破 1000 亿瑞士法郎（约合 1100 亿美元），其主要的珠宝品牌卡地亚（Cartier）的吸引力使其股价大涨。【原文：Swiss luxury conglomerate Richemont’s stock market value surpassed 100 billion Swiss francs ($110 billion) for the first time, bolstered by the appeal of its blockbuster jewelry label Cartier.】

item.title: 爱尔兰总理马丁连任归来
item.description: 在 11 月举行的选举中，主要执政联盟伙伴重新掌权，爱尔兰 Fianna Fail 党领导人米歇尔-马丁（Micheal Martin）于周四被选为总理。【原文：Micheal Martin, leader of Ireland’s Fianna Fail party, was voted in as prime minister on Thursday after an election in November that saw the main incumbent coalition partners return to power.】

item.title: 美国申请失业救济人数略有上升，但经常性申请人数激增
item.description: 领取救济金的美国人数攀升至三年多来的新高，而首次申请美国失业保险的人数则有所上升。【原文：The number of Americans on benefit rolls climbed to a more than three-year high, while first-time applications for US unemployment insurance edged higher.】

item.title: 通胀挂钩债券可能获得 2008 年危机以来的最高收益率
item.description: 周四的通胀保值型美国国债拍卖将创下十多年来的最高收益率。【原文：An auction of inflation-protected US Treasuries on Thursday is poised to draw the highest yield in more than a decade.】
